awd_abstract_narration:
In this project, the investigator and his colleagues will study selected topics in high-dimensional statistics and data science.  This work will help scientists working in biotechnology and other areas, who generate large scale datasets, to interpret and uncover the important patterns in their data. This should help scientists and doctors to discover the biological bases of many diseases, and improve prognosis and treatment selection for patients.

Specifically, these projects will include an interaction model for high-dimensional regression and classification, a statistical model for studying mouse and human genomic comparisons, a selective inference approach to average treatment effect estimation (ATE), and a research monograph on post-selection inference in statistics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
From the support of this award, I published a number new research ideas that will enable scientists to better extract knowledge from complex datasets. I also produced public domain software that implements these ideas. The methods should be useful for medical scientists working in diverse areas such as cancer and heart disease,  and data scientists in business and finance. The methods that I have developed can be thought of  machine learning techniques, but with a statistcial emphasis, known as "statistical learning" . These methods seek to produce models that are interpretable by the user, providing, for example a list of the important features that are used in a prediction. In addtiion, statistical learning methods provide measures of uncertainty for the results, giving an indication of the expected accuracy a method when it is appled to future data. Statistical learning methods also tend to be simpler that machine learning techniques, so that if their performance degrades in the future, the reason for thie failure csan be more easly diagnosed and fixed. In addition, I trained  8 PhD stuidents, all of whom are now working in academia and industry. One of these graduates is working as a Data Scientist for the Los Angeles Dodgers baseball team.


Last Modified: 10/31/2021
Modified by: Robert Tibshirani
